div.p: EC-OpenShift plugin integrates with an OpenShift cluster. The plugin assumes that you already have a OpenShift cluster depoyed and available to access API. You would also need a service account which has full access on projects that you intend to use through this plugin.

Please note that some of names given in Flow UI will be modified to comply with the naming conventions of Kubernetes. Specifically characters such as "space , _ " will be converted to "-". Such parameters are marked with a asterisk (*) in procedure details

Plugin configurations are sets of parameters that apply across some or all of the plugin procedures. They reduce repetition of common values, create predefined parameter sets for end users, and securely store credentials where needed. Each configuration is given a unique name that is entered in designated parameters on procedures that use them.
To create plugin configurations in ElectricFlow, do these steps:
div.li: Go to Administration > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Click Configure to open the OpenShift Configurations page.

For communicating with OpenShift cluster, you need two configurations:
1. Base address of API Endpoint URL
2. Bearer token which has authorization to access API. The bearer token should correspond to a ServiceAccount
